Name: Windows - Create Event Source
Description:
Establishes the specified source name as a valid event source for writing entries to a log on the local computer. 

This method can also create a new custom log on the local computer.
Author: HumanPrinter

Properties.Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody:
$sourceName = $OctopusParameters["EventSourceName"]
$logName = $OctopusParameters["EventLogName"]

$sourceExists = [System.Diagnostics.EventLog]::SourceExists($sourceName)
if($sourceExists) {
	Write-Output "Event source $sourceName already exist."
	return
}

[System.Diagnostics.EventLog]::CreateEventSource($sourceName, $logName)

Parameters.Name: EventSourceName
Parameters.Label: Source name
Parameters.HelpText: The source name by which the application is registered on the local computer.

Parameters.Name: EventLogName
Parameters.Label: Log name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include Application, System, or a custom event log.
